questions.text: What is the mechanism of action of Moclobemide among the following options?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

MAO inhibitor

Highyeild:

Moclobemide It is a reversible and selective MAO-A inhibitor with a short duration of action Full MAO activity is restored within 1–2 days of stopping the drug. Because of competitive enzyme inhibition, tyramine can displace it from the enzyme so that potentiation of pressor response to ingested amines is minor, and dietary restrictions are not required. Clinical trials have shown moclobemide to be an efficacious antidepressant, comparable to TCAs, except in severe cases. It lacks the anticholinergic, sedative, cognitive, psychomotor, and cardiovascular adverse effects of typical TCAs and is safer in overdose. This makes it a particularly good option for elderly patients and in those with heart disease.

MAO inhibitors are a class of drugs that inhibit the activity of one or both monoamine oxidase enzymes: monoamine oxidase A (MAO-A) and monoamine oxidase B (MAO-B). questions.correct_answer: A. It is a specific antagonist of benzodiazepine receptor
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It is a specific antagonist of benzodiazepine receptor

Highyeild:

Flumazenil, an imidazobenzodiazepine derivative is a specific antidote of benzodiazepine receptors (BZDs) It undergoes quick redistribution and is a short-acting drug. Hence, repeated dosing may be necessary. Since it is a specific antidote, therefore, the drug has no value in poisoning by other CNS depressants. The drug is also useful in hepatic coma. Since, it blocks BZDs receptors; it is the drug of choice for BZD overdose. The drug is also useful in zaleplone or zolpidem poisoning. The effect of the drug is rapid and is seen within 2-3 minutes. Starting dose is 200 microgram every 1-2 minutes and maximum dose is 3 mg/hour. It is noteworthy that the drug should not routinely be used in patients with decreased levels of consciousness in patients with poisoning by other CNS depressants.
